p3p3Zn4lVLl2pe2p6qjCwg.text: A really smart, friendly pub which I'd definitely recommend trying if you're in the area. The only downside is that it's quite food-orientated, so don't expect to be able to lounge in comfort unless you're planning to eat. That said, the high bar stools are comfortable enough and there's plenty of space to sit outside if it's a nice day. I've never tried it, but apparently they do cookery courses on their top floor which, given the fairly high standard of their food, must be worth a look.

j060A2iJWRmfxRD40I5Drw.text: Great local place.  Fish & chips really good & the atmosphere was very cozy.  Highly recommend.

6Ss3VxLSJeydaqyk52PrIg.text: Had a very nice meal here on recommendations of Yelp.  The service was really good.  The night was perfect, as they took off the window and let the nice air in.  Food was solid.  The crispy cunard (duck) salad was very good.  I had the roast leg of lamb dinner with Yorkshire pudding.  Surprisingly my favorite thing on the plate was the braised cabbage and sauteed kale.  The lamb was a little overdone.  The pear tart tatin was very good for dessert.

Xak-0G1NaRlhi29WmAZF1A.text: An honest breakfast. It's a pub not a restaurant. But you could still take someone and get away with it. Quality food. Honestly presented. Good coffee. Big pots of tea. Slightly incongruous to be in a pub decor (smelt ever-so-slightly of last night's beer. Not good for pastries. Worth a punt if you're in that part of town and your shoes aren't expensive enough for Ceconnis.

IcVCD-WMVa0zzv6Op_6akg.text: This is about as Mayfair as it gets. Really posh, and full of really posh people talking about silverware. We just had a quick subversive shot of tequila and left.

1IvzJNi3Zkj0SO2WIEW27A.text: I really like this place. It is a modern style pub with upscale pub food. The service is friendly. Great that you can open the whole window fronts and use the window sill as a counter. Nice place for afterwork drink with colleagues.

KFbgaA8yzJszxMy0oIRrjQ.text: good food, attentive staff, definitely not for the here we go crowd, thank goodness. not everyones cup of tea. non pretentious, but you do have to know how to hold a knife and fork. if the lighting was any more subduded all the menus would be in braille. not suitable for poseurs either. a nice place for nice people. quite pricey.

JbUzjX8Vc7uUIhPRcIw0ZQ.text: IF you happen to be an American homesick for a great burger, you can find it at the Only Running Footman.  If you, more likely, are not an American homesick for a great burger, but do still want a good Mayfair pub, you can find it here as well.My friend (who is an American living in London) brought us here while I was visiting a few weeks ago.  The menu is a great blend of typical pub fare and more upscale and unique options: there is something for everyone.  Immediately upon sitting down, my friend declared that she wanted the "excellent" burger, but if you want to try something different, be sure to have a glance at the chalkboard on the wall - that is where they write the specials.In all, it was a delicious and fun meal, and I can see how this place would be great for everything from a drink with coworkers to an evening out with friends.

hIVM06reJFefS0UyzZTKgg.text: Would love to have tried the food there, but it was so crowded on a Monday night it wasn't even possible to get in the door.

OVIudS8EOPhFiObmBD3ceA.text: This place is lovely.Excellent food, smart crowd, friendly staff. Good for a few drinks and a nice bite. More bijoux restaurant than pub, but really very nice!

uf_LGxZtz9ZIC9v6LRAV2Q.text: Compared with the other offerings in this super touristy, super hotel chain area, this place is satisfactory. However, based on the prior reviews, my dining companion and I were expecting a better meal. For example, my friend's savory pie was composed of a not-well-baked top crust and a super runny interior. The amusing part of our dining experience was that we seemed to have infiltrated the secret meeting of the league of extraordinarily douchey gentlemen, where the preferred uniform of choice was pink shirts, cardigans around shoulders and/or navy blazers accessorized with fake tans and perfectly coiffed hair. I can't guarantee that your dining experience will involve such an amusing crowd, but my friend and I were pleasantly entertained.

DatwAnWRy7WBk0e9FPyuqQ.text: I came here last week for dinner while visiting a friend in London and have been craving the meal I had ever since. Most of the menu looks like standard pub food, but they had interesting specials posted on the wall. I got the poached smoked haddock special with colcannon mashed potatoes, a poached egg, and hollandaise. Oh my...it was good. One of my friends got the rump steak, which looked a little boring but she said it was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. My other friend got the burger, which looked phenomenal. The service was very nice and the prices were reasonable. I hope to come back next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Poached Smoked Haddock with Colcannon Mash

6B3CoKz7ehRBQRbzxa5NfA.text: We stayed at the Grosvenor House and this was within a short 10 minute walk.  Service was excellent and the good was as well.  Definitely recommend it if you're staying in or near Mayfair.

4z4vB8y1mvY9sqreF1wGyw.text: Only 4 out of 12 beers on tap?!! I know it's Sunday and a big footie day, and maybe I'm be very American about this, but I'd say a proper pub shouldn't run out of 75% of it's draft beer selection by 530pm. That and pretty mediocre food makes me think that the "gastropub" tag given to this joint is a little off. Let's say it's just a plain old 2 1/2 star pub.

yFmYhacY6wPOj--2PpMTOg.text: Definitely recommended gastropub in Mayfair.  Surprisingly small inside, resies might be needed.  We went for lunch one day, and Sunday breakfast on another.  Lunch was busy, breakfast was quiet.  Good - the variety and quality of the food definitely qualifies this wee spot as a gastropub. Overall the service was reserved, but capable.Less good - only one toilet.  One of our waitstaff was from Eastern Europe and couldn't handle our Canadian english (she was perfectly pleasant, and handed off to a colleague who could make the translation more easily).  Chicken and mushroom pie-of-the-day for me and burger and chips for my wife at lunch.  English breakfast for me and pancakes + strawberries for my wife for Sunday breakfast.  Overall, very satisfied.  A small but quality spot in Mayfair.

3NPl--PObHMI_PMyXOG5JA.text: Great cozy atmosphere and service. Blackboard specials ate great with reasonable prices. Total local feel. Best martini I have ever had to top it all off.

7vaZx3ECAVizFLI25jz1PA.text: Nice enough I suppose but rammed full both inside and outside, mostly by idiots in suits, so I didn't feel like hanging around.

t-aOdRCeTWlUYhHU9FdrEA.text: A recommendation from a local cabbie brought me to this fair pub. Apparently the place has been there for hundreds of years and serves a nice selection of locally sourced English style pub food. Upon arrival we were nervous we would not be able to eat because the crowd was spilling out of the bar and onto the streets. Luckily for us, most of them were there only for after work drinks! We were quickly seated and I ordered a local bombardier IPA which had a nice bitter taste and my colleague had a green king IPA which he said was very good. It is worth noting, they have a lot  gluten free options, such as the Colchester Rock Oysters. They are served in a Cabernet and shallot vinegar sauce which was awesome, extra sauce please! The heirloom tomato salad and the minted jersey royals (baby potatoes with mint) were very fresh and a nice light start. My entree was a well prepared small portion of monk fish in curry sauce. The sticky toffy pudding, a traditional English desert, was sweet, well balanced by refreshing ice cream and just right for sharing. Overall really good British experience, especially thanks to our friendly and dry humored server :)

eoHuSMmzfBkCP8cQbulkhQ.text: Set on a quiet corner in Mayfair (and thus frequented by hedge funders and the like), The Only Running Footman used to be a classic, dark lost-in-time boozer, complete with tatty red carpeting and the smell of old beer.  It's since been restored and now operates as a smooth and classy gastropub plus event space plus cookery school.  The food has gotten good reviews - you can eat in the ground-floor bar or upstairs in the stylish dining room - and while I haven't had a chance to have a meal here, having a drink in the bar is a much more comfortable affair than in the past.  It can get horribly crowded and noisy, but the room feels considerably brighter and less stuffy (wish I could say the same for the clientele).  In the summer, it's also nice to relish a pint curbside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. www.themeredithgroup.co.uk

smZIkymztq0abNrqri8ofQ.text: Cool place, good food, but horribly slow service.

NvQg52g2harNtfZvcUfpdw.text: I was given a recomendation from a work colleague to go here for dinner while in London  The bar area was packed and spilled out into the street which is common in London, I guess.  It was a fun place to grab a Guiness.  The upstairs was quite and darker which was a change from the ground floor.  The food was good, not great.  All in all it was an enjoyable time.  If  Ilived in the area I would go back, but as someone who only goes to London on occasion I will probably try someplace else.

JykoIBGrDjNYLH8avW2mAA.text: Just go - just do it!:):)You will be pleased and satisfied!Great food - we ordered the haddock and chips, with mushy peas... We had been craving a good fish & chip experience. TORF came thru in spectacular fashion!!! Washed it all down with a cider and local pint  and had even indulged in a yummy dessert -the fruit and nut crumble  Everything is locally sourced and organic. Wonderfully upscale pub atmosphere.  Lots of business type locals-guys in suits or jeans and nice shirts ( it must have been " british casual Friday"). We were made to feel very welcome....big red YELP sticker is displayed in the window.Go - you'll be happy you did!!

vEuAH6cGRIKZ2tBtrRtoZg.text: Had a few very good lunches and dinners at this gastropub. It has great ambience and is good for a casual dinner or to go watch a game and have a pint or glass of wine. The food was local, organic and well prepared. Their desserts were nice as well. To top it off, Clint Eastwood was having a pint at the bar one of the evenings we were there. I agree it's one of the better gastropubs and reasonably priced. Recommended for lunch and dinner.

bsSg7FzDllAyS7Inoz1daQ.text: Came here my first night in London and according to everything I read this was a good choice for a gastro pub in the mayfair area.  It was good- I had the fried fish and my boyfriend had the burger.  Both dishes hit the gastro spot.  We came a little late (surprised that they only serve food until 10pm) so we didn't get to enjoy the food and the atmosphere as much as we would have liked.  If you go I would say 8pm is a really ideal time to get a meal there and then hang out and drink.  This pub introduced me to Steffe beer which I have now come to really love! Cheers!

xJcbM3kyxqlWxprFlEVzWg.text: I love this place! My best friend and I were in London for a few days and found this little eatery thanks to Yelp. We were staying at the May Fair, so it was a pleasant surprise to find the Footman just a few blocks behind us. I had the linguini with grilled vegetables for dinner, and promptly went back for Eggs Benedict the next day (because I dreamed about them). The flavor was good, the noodles were cooked perfectly (although they had a tad too much olive oil on them), and the veggies were wonderfully fresh after a week's worth of fried carbs. My friend had the pork medallions, which were really tender and well-seasoned. We ended the night with the bitter chocolate cheesecake and honeycomb ice cream. Unlike most cheesecakes, this sliver was just right in terms of sweetness. I really liked the ice cream. I was not, however, a fan of the butter brickle crumbles or whatever garnished the plate... too sticky on the teeth.

u68T8HdZK6pDVlrcsdfZVA.text: I came in at 11am and they didn't open for lunch until 11:30am, but they served me anyways.  I ordered fish and chips with some breakfeast tea.  The servers were distant, but when engaged were pleasant.  I waited a short time for a amazing visual of a single breaded filet atop onion rich creamy tartar sauce and mashed peas with mint(the mint was quite refreshing).  I ate quickly as I was having a late breakfast and was famished.  I left with a pleasant meal and little else, but would likely return due to the quality of the food.

Pf6AJtYl1HwlOFZDxHV0LA.text: We had a couple of cold beers here before enjoying our lunch. This charming little place had Budvar (the wonderful Czech beer) on tap. It was cold and delicious. The service was attentive but not pushy. For lunch we had to try the Fish and chips, although I must say we were the only patrons in sight that choose that dish. There were numerous comfort food specials that looked great, but we went the tourist route. The chips were very thick, freshly fried and tasty. The fish was piping hot, not greasy and also tasty. For pub fare, The Only Running Footman is tough to beat.

5bv9g9sbN8jhnNxNTEQL8A.text: Mayfair is a bit of a too-tidy wasteland when it comes to pubs, but TORF seems to keep busy by keeping the pretense low, the drinks flowing, and the menu not too far removed from its Brit pub roots.Highs: - surprisingly good (as in quality + inexpensive) wine list for an after-work shared bottle or dinner;- venison pie very nice;- fish and chips respectably good and -- especially for Mayfair -- authentic without killing you in oil;- If you're the sort to grab a beer and stand around and drink, there's typically an after-work crowd spilling out from the bar onto the sidewalk, drinks in hand, chatting and laughing so long as it's not raining too muchThe beer menu is limited, so if you're looking for a 40-ales-of-the-Isles pub, TORF is not for you.If you're in Mayfair for business, or staying in a nearby hotel, highly recommended.

jXLIx5LpQwAESbXFo4-StQ.text: We stumbled across this cute little pub after an exhausting travel day and enjoyed it so much that we went back again on our last night. It's a busy, lively place that can get a little loud, expecially when the after-work crowd hits but everyone was friendly and welcoming.I expected burgers, fish & chips and light pub fare so the menu surprised me.  It's definitely a gastropub with daily specials and a well-rounded menu.  The diver scallops, salmon, rib eye and salads were all very good.  An yes, the fish & chips were a hit too.

yGFm6rmBgbEa-FCXFSyYeg.text: This place has THE best fish and chips! I thought I had found my favorite fish and chip place long ago in Ventura County in California, but I was wrong. The batter is so tasty and the chips are incredible! Now I know why England is known for their fish and chips!

vle3iTUmiOADj_7wsUkJZw.text: We started our day in London traveling here and about mid afternoon headed out to The Only Running Foot Man Pub and ordered the best fish and chips I've ever had.   It was actually the couple we met in Paris that highly recommended it.  Wow, can I tell you...it was so good!  I mean I have had fish and chips before, but this...this was the best I've ever had!   Oddly, it tasted really light, and crispy.  It was really good.  I got the Turkey dinner but ended up eating half of Matt's s fish and chips, soooo good, mm mm mm...

8YecabJM59TJEGk3LVAmmg.text: I have only had beer here. The selection I felt was limited and the service is not that great. I have been here twice and pretty much the same feeling both times. In a very quiet section of Mayfair, but always a large crowd.

jJlJet7yzj-09uFQcNcAvw.text: I suspect I'm becoming something of a pub snob, but this pub didn't wow me. To be honest, I came here sort of out of desperation (it's one of the few pubs in this area) and I only came as a launching point to meet friends before a night out in Mayfair. The staff was friendly and attentive and the beers and ciders on tap were pretty standard, but nothing really sticks out in my mind when I think of this pub. I didn't have the food, so can only speak to the pub from more of a drinking / ambiance feel which didn't thoroughly impress me. However, I would go back if I were in the area, just wouldn't go out of my way to visit.

Dl8VyMA1ebs-YrP_ObyEMg.text: Good atmosphere an excellent pub food.  The steak and frites was the best pub food that I have had in London.  I would definitely recommend it.

bJyThpisultlmE6wW370hQ.text: Went here for dinner (upstairs restaurant) before heading to the cinema.  It was not very crowded at 7pm but the room is small and cozy.  The service was good and the food was very good and served quickly.   We each had a glass of Malbec, which is was also good.  It's in a good location and reasonably priced compared to other restaurants.  Enjoy!

YHScSH6uYLOIYwhtsMWVMw.text: Found this pub as we were roaming the streets of London looking for a pint.  This place looked poppin' so we decided to drop in.  The pub was crowded with young people just getting off work and still in their work clothes.  As the evening went on, the pub got more and more crowded where folks were drinking outside in the winter cold.  We decided to do dinner there and I ordered the fish and chips with mushy peas while my husband got the pheasant.  Fish and chips were so good.  Batter was light and crispy, fish was juicy.  Pheasant was overcooked and dry.  Service was pretty  much nonexistent and if you wanted to order anything you really had to wave someone down.  Overall, fun place to hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. fish and chips w/mushy peas

ztlNRqBV5BiiugIgzVwY5w.text: In short this was a nice place with nice food almost ruined by one shit waitress. We went on a le cool walking tour and I'd already read about this place and was excited to try it out. The pub is quite upscale almost to the point where it's a restaurant with a bar on the side. They had a small television and even changed the channel for me so I could watch some rugby. Couldn't flag down a waitress so went up to the bar to order and immediately didn't care for the waitress. She had an elongated sigh that lasted the entirety of me ordering but I thought hey, everyone has an off day. Just when the food was arriving I was away from the table and came back to find that the venison pie I ordered was actually chicken. I called the same waitress over and asked if this was venison and she told me it was. I said it doesn't look like venison and she picked up the plate and walked away without saying anything. A few minutes later the manager came over and said sorry they're out of venison and the waitress should have said so I told him chicken was fine. They brought the plate back out which was now a cold pie and mash. He gave us a free drink, or rather he gave another drink and we left without paying for it. Overall this place is too pricey to be a gastropub and too uptight to be decent enough for a few drinks. A shame as it was nice and they had some good menu options. Just not in stock.

_4mFtCOUmWhPl9Je43aQ-w.text: This pub was recommended by the concierge at our hotel and a taxi driver and we were not disappointed.  We went for a late lunch on a rainy day and when we walked in the door the staff could not have been more welcoming.  Our waitress was super friendly (young woman from Budapest), I had fish and chips, my husband had the special of the day and we both were happy with the quality and the quantity of the food.  It was a nice mix of locals and tourists.  Our lunch with one glass of wine came to $85US, which was pretty standard for our lunches in London.  I would definitely recommend.

5nN57_jednk6hPLccu2BKg.text: Good selection of ales for a pub that is essentially a restaurant.Good traditional fayre, friendly service nice atmosphere.

lasUd5_r9Vtj1B0odrmNIQ.text: On a recent trip to London, my friend and I were looking for a casual night out with some good pub food. The concierge of our hotel came to our rescue with The Only Running Footman as a recommendation so we set off to walk the 10 blocks or so to Mayfair to check this place out. Located in the middle of a quiet neighborhood, the Only Running Footman was a treat indeed. First of all, the place was packed as there were football playoffs on at the time and the locals were all rooting for their second choice favorite since their local team had already gone down in defeat. We opted to sit in the more casual pub area although there is a "fancier" restaurant upstairs as is often the case with pubs in London/ We scored a great seat by the window letting us look out on the street and perused the menu. There were several specials of the night but we opted for the fish and chips (yeah- I know- how touristy of us) and the stew. That and a couple of pints and we were extremely happy with our choices as the food was good and the beer cold. We ended up talking to a couple of the people next to us who actually worked at another place owned by the same people and they proceeded to close down the place with us. Friendly staff, good service and food that scored almost as many points as the Italians did that night! Next time I'm in London, I'll definitely stop back in.

vfnwifEIX04wXgjaNNcEpw.text: It was the day of the big presentation. My reason for coming half way around the world to my new favorite European city (changing by the month these days). And I rocked it. In fact, everyone involved with the conference rocked it. It was time to celebrate.I was hoping I'd get a proper pub experience while here, and while celebrating with the team, oh did I get it. Shortly after going up to the bar I made a new friend. Drinking since getting off work and quickly picking up on my American accent, we got right into it:- He and 25 of his friends, ah, make that mates are going to a stag (bachelor party in our version of English) in Las Vegas next year. He wanted some advice. My advice to Las Vegas: you have no idea what's coming. - He accused me of drinking water. After convincing him it was a gin & tonic, we were best mates.- He then accused me of bringing "like" and "totally" across the pond. I absolutely did not, and of course slipped in a "like" while defending myself. Fail.- We were back to best mates after another round. Some other pub character almost spilled a drink on me while waiting for my beverage. See proper experience, wanted, above. Thank you.- We ended the conversation bonding over Armin Van Buuren (he had just seen him, mind was blown) and sharing my jealousy he was seeing Above & Beyond in a few weeks. I think my music passion finally won him over for good. I can talk dance music with the best of them.So I got my proper pub experience: A celebration. A new mate. A drink almost spilled. A vibe that is uniquely London. To my new friend: I'll be back for that third round soon.

v1UwTovVzRda7PAyCYo3CQ.text: Had Christmas Dinner here and it was great!  Food, Service and price compared to the only few restaurants open on Christmas Day serving the traditional fare.

GCygaC80UDVa6H8uUqlf4w.text: Pub/restaurant is well presented and staff polite. However we arrived on time for our 21:30 reservation last Sunday only to be told that the kitchen had been closed due to there being too few diners that evening. No phone call to warn us of this, only disappointment upon arrival. We had booked online through open table. If you plan to try dining here I recommend speaking to them by phone to confirm.

U5g8At5mBdHtAmO_dDfaog.text: We stopped into this pub at the suggestion of the concierge at our hotel.  We were extremely pleased we did!  TORF is more of a gastropub with great food and the room itself was bright and cheery - the pints were great too...  We sat down to order a late lunch and I had one of the best plates of fish and chips I've ever had.  My wife also loved her food and we were both very impressed with the place.  There was a good mix of people there from the suit and tie crowd winding down their day to the casual visitors/tourists dropping in.  I made a point to eat there again on our trip and would highly recommend it to anyone.

7INwEx5IDN-yRQjWL58u3Q.text: Good prices good food, though it does get busy by 12:30.  Pro-tip,  book a reservation online and then you can be sure to get a table for lunch.

8K4wOj4BXJS0KGOsntc0uQ.text: A tiny little place. Yes, there are stuffed suits  it's just off Berkley Square FGS, and yes it looks a little restauranty. It does get crowded because it's small. All that said and done, it's cosy, half the price of the mwah-bars round here and very friendly. Only downside is that, being withing waddling distance of the great concrete monstrosity round the corner, you will find a lot of our less cultured and loud Atlantic cousins here. Live with it though. The beers good, and a game of watch the bright white sneakers and sports socks is always good for a laugh.

Pp58nmf8jM6_snkjL_MN_w.text: My family recently visited London.  (Two adults, two small kids.)  This place is a gem and we're sorry we didn't try it sooner.  It's an easy walk from our favorite hotel. (The Athenaeum)  The service is terrific. The food was out-of-this-world good.  All organic produce, lovely yummy fish & chips, great steak, perfect chicken & mustard pie.  The salad was a delight.  (I'm from California, so that's saying something.)  And, they have a secret kids menu!  In addition to fish & chips and chicken, my kids devoured the broccoli and carrots from the sides menu.  The only reason that I deducted a star was the heat.  It was evening on a hot day and the pub was sweltering.  If they could have lowered the temp by a few degrees, I would have been in heaven.

Ca4O-McRwo_o-D29Q5qDHw.text: After asking around I was convinced by the consierge of my hotel to try their fish and chips.Absolutely delicious and paired with great service provided by Cristina.We will be back and thank you.

cI7V_NM37UYShJtHTBLWPw.text: Probably my favorite local pub that we went to in London.  It's very convenient to The Chesterfield Mayfair.  The selection of beer was okay, and the service was very good.  We drank and ate downstairs at the window, and had a great time.  The fish and chips, with mushy peas, were the best we had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips, mushy peas, and a nice mug of bitters.

yx3C8sNa6A_mmixjzMNYpw.text: This is nice gastropub tucked in Mayfair and they do a pretty good Sunday Roast. We sat on the second floor (or first floor in British terms) and had the floor to ourselves on a Sunday evening. It was nice as we brought our two young kids who had an absolute mess and were a little noisy! The staff didn't mind and were very accommodating to our messy girls. I enjoyed the roast, although thought the potatoes could've been a big more crispy, but otherwise a good meal.

IlV6TKtdftaTUljlF1EPlA.text: We got the shareable appetizer plate/meat board. It was huge and could have prob been our meal. Followed up with an order of "fish & chips" each. We should have only ordered 1 to split after that board. Food was good. Service was attentive but not the friendliest

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Mixed fruit cider
Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. "Fish and chips" we should've shared it
Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Appetizer platter for 2. This could have easily been a meal.

91doKrcbs8euiNpexZjMuA.text: Great spot!  Always loved this pkace and now reopened as The Footman.  Its not closed.

qEd3UOMS9hkg7bbSIxr6IA.text: We are in the upstairs dining room. We started with the oysters... Delicious. For main courses my wife ordered the beet ravioli and I ordered the seafood linguini. Really nice overall. Zero disappointments. If in London you should try this place out for sure.Sticky toffee pudding with ice cream? Oh my Jebus.

QXyQSjc_vrwfNW9gPi0wfQ.text: It is surprisingly difficult for a tourist to find good English food in London. To this end, I definitely recommend the Footman. I went on a Wednesday evening, and the place was packed with business men and women looking for an after-work drink. It was loud and slightly difficult tot get a table. The waiter was very nice, but misunderstood my drink order and gave me Italian beer rather than vodka. When I did get a vodka with orange soda, it was in fact vodka with orange juice and seltzer. We both had the fish & chips, which was served with smashed peas. It was wonderful! The "tartar" sauce was more of a creamy onion sauce and the peas weren't the sweet peas that I am used to, but I loved them both. Two thumbs up for food, middle of the road on the other fronts.

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips
Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom

Zsyhjzq6BCNs7CrRwBpLwA.text: It was busy at the pub which clearly meant it was a popular place to eat/drink.  If you're coming here for dinner, I highly suggest making a reservation which is pretty easy using Yelp! The food was good, but not as good to rave about.  I had the lasagna which was tasty and filling but pretty standard.

vZ4DhxqTMydHnt1PsT3MeA.text: This is a good pub as pubs go. Excellent service and a really kind waitstaff. Great chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had fish and chips. Both were excellent! Love the atmosphere too and as a bonus, ran into John Malkovich out front. Cool!

rU8KkK5dH1LJOruWEXG5Lg.text: Thanks Yelp, another great find in London. We made reservation with TopTable only to find that it was for the ritzier upstairs. No worries, they let us sit in the more casual pub down stairs by the bar. Awesome service, very un-pub like in that way. Three of us shared the fish and chips. We loved the fish and the mushy peas, chips were average. But then on a whim we shared one order of their sticky toffee pudding! One was not enough, it was the best I ever had. Many puddings are way to sweet to eat more than a bite. This sticky pudding was perfectly addictive. I would return for this alone!

vTq4yuGqadjOKS_LFvDsKQ.text: First stop in London. Good choice. We'll be back.  Check out their Facebook page. Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Great neighborhood.

m_gPd4UFLZNn3GMLPRTGeA.text: I always make it a point to hit this gem of a pub when I'm in London, and bring my colleagues along. I can't say enough good things about their fish and chips - especially on a cold day! Beer selection is a bit limited but I always find something I like. The last time I was in, an apparent keep favorite "John" was hanging out. John was VERY drunk for 6pm and didn't quite get the hint that I didn't have any desire to talk to him. Despite the obvious signs the keeps kept defending him saying "Oh, you don't know John, John's a great man"...if he was so damn great he'd leave me the hell alone!  Stop in for some fish and chips, and be weary of John - don't say I didn't warn you!

lBrfh9hJGOxF-mqIjIA28A.text: This gastropub is a 10 minute walk from the Sheraton Park Lane and is probably the closest decent food to the hotel.  We went for brunch on a Sunday (served until noon I think) and liked it enough that we went back again during the week for breakfast, same menu.  The food was quite good, showing how far pub fare has come in the last few years since I was last in London.  There is a nice dining seating area so it's more of a restaurant with a bar attached than a pub.  We sat at a table by the open window and enjoyed the breeze.We had the french toast, which was fine but unremarkable (note that it's served with jam and creme fraiche rather than syrup, and smoked salmon with scrambled eggs, which were very good.Service was good, though the waiter was a bit absentminded and kept forgetting things.  The second time we went back, the waitress was efficient but a bit cold.  Not enough to affect our meal though.They serve a daily menu for lunch and dinner.  It was not crowded at all when we went but when I passed by in the late afternoon it was absolutely packed with an afterwork crowd quaffing ale.

FwWwAQoD8wvlHkA3MroZ1g.text: Wow....if you come here....do yourself a favor and order 2 things....the creamed spinach and the foie gras (pate). OMG. Both are heavenly. Who woulda thunk, in the middle of Mayfair? Yum!!  The staff is super sweet also. Fab!!!

HLLYfga2Vz5Cb2jqByLXTw.text: This pub was always packed. We visited the pub during lunch and it was good. My boyfriend had the crab legs and really enjoyed them. I had the chicken sandwich. It came with a nice salad and chips. Nice little pub.

qFgxMhIH2Pn-vaiq9IWVTw.text: This was a nice place for lunch...fish and chips, and Shepard pie were all pretty good. Bloody Mary's were not my favorite..but they had good beer on tap

w7lQuhdLVXhoz0Hx6ixGzA.text: Definitely a Five Star and place to visit. We had the best service, Sophie, excellent food, great beer and lots fun.

photos.caption: Photo of The Footman - London, United Kingdom. Meet Sophie

tQZLy-1QuJ7ho7Y7dPYKOA.text: Well, on the last day of the Jubilee weekend, we were out and about with some visiting friends, and I decided we should go have dinner at a place I'd been wanting to try. So we went to Green Park, walked to the restaurant, to find that it was closed. Alas, no Burger and Lobster for me this time.However, The Only Running Footman was just around the corner, and thanks to the high Yelp rating, we dashed over here in the rain to have a few drinks and dinner. It's a gastropub, so it's trying to be a bit posher than your standard pub food. So, we all started with the foie gras and liver pate. It was delicious! I had the burger, and while it was a tasty burger, it wasn't anything special. The person who got the fish and chips raved about it (so much she ate it all without sharing). The person getting the pie said it was quite good. We also got dessert. I had the rhubarb crumble and it was fantastic. The cheese plate looked nice. The pavlova looked like the meringue was store bought (unfortunately). But the berries looked nice.There was a decent selection of ales (Green King IPA, Young's Bitter, and Bombadier) so things on that front were nice. If I were in the area, and we felt the need for a bit of gastropubbing, this would probably be the place we'd go!

p5DbjikwMDJ579xEHAdivA.text: As a touristy Yank, I wanted to find a cozy pub on a cool fall day. This place fit the bill! The food is delish. I had a great feature soup and salad with a pint. I highly recommend it! I'll be coming back for sure! I guess it's got to be good when this pub is older than my country!

PhGq6La9NLEFuHoDSMC9fw.text: What an interesting find this place was. We popped in here for lunch and had a sandwich and a chicken pie. The pastry on the pie was deliciously flaky but I have a pet peeve about pies that have no bottom crust. This one did not and it needed it! The gravy inside was really flavorful though and the chicken had a tenderness to it that was nice. Steak sandwich was good but nothing special. The nice addition was the fries (not chips, i.e. thin fries!) which were super crispy.Wouldn't go back for the food but they do pour a fine Guinness which I would certainly return for and their real ale selection was also noteworthy.
